page.title: 01NANTYMOEL FARM
page.content: NANTYMOEL FARM IS ONE OF TWO SMALL,HILL FARMS IN THE REGION.IT IS OVER 500 YEARS OLD,AND IS 2000 ACRES IN SIZE.SHEEP AND CATTLE ARE KEPT ON THE FARM.THERE ARE 1500 SHEEP AND 30 COWS.THE COWS ARE FRIESIANS AND ARE KEPT FOR MILKING,THE MILK IS SENT TO A LOCAL DAIRY. IN WINTER THE COWS ARE KEPT IN THE DUTCH BARN OR MONOPITCH.AT SPRINGTIME FENCES ARE REPAIRED AND LAMBING AND CALVING BEGINS.IN THE SUMMER THE SHEEP ARE SHEARED AND THEN DIPPED.DURING AUTUMN NEW GRASS SEED IS SOWN ON FIELDS FOR GRAZING.WHEN WINTER COMES THE FARMER BRINGS THE COWS INTO THE FARMYARD TO STAY IN THE BARNS.THREE MEN WORK FULL TIME ON THE FARM.
